alert.note: Alert for Manitowoc (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 05 at 6:35PM CST until March 05 at 8:45PM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Wisconsin, including the following counties, Calumet and Manitowoc. * WHEN...Until 945 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some basement flooding is also possible through this evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 631 PM CST, Local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will continue to cause minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Manitowoc, Chilton, Brillion, Cleveland, Valders, St. Nazianz, Camp Rokilio Scout Camp, St Anna, High Cliff State Park, Northern Lake Winnebago, Central Lake Winnebago, Two Rivers, Harrison, Kiel, New Holstein, Newton, Cato, Spring Valley, Brothertown and Reedsville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
